reporter_caption.center: CELLA v. CITY OF CHICAGO, 303 Ill. App. 56 (1939)

caption.center: John F. Cella et al., Appellants, v. City of Chicago, Appellee.

court.center: Appellate Court of Illinois, First District.

opinion.syllabus:
EMINENT DOMAIN, § 331[fn*] — acceptance of principal ofcondemnation award without protest, not waiver of claim forinterest. Claim for interest, in absence of any protest by owner at time when condemnation judgment was paid, was not extinguished or waived by acceptance of principal.
[fn*] See Callaghan's Illinois Digest, same topic and section number.
opinion.posture: Appeal from Superior Court of Cook County; Hon. FRANCIS B. ALLEGRETTI, presiding. Judgments reversed and judgments here for plaintiffs and against the city of Chicago, as specified. Heard in second division, first district, at February term, 1939; opinion filed December 27, 1939.
opinion.attorneys:
Aaron Soble and William Feldman, for appellants; Max Chill and Jerome S. Klein, of counsel;
Barnet Hodes, Corporation Counsel, for appellee; Joseph F. Grossman, First Assistant Corporation Counsel, and J. Herzl Segal, Assistant Corporation Counsel, of counsel.
